Reviews.Title: 2nd Nokia 620 for spouse - Nice things come in small packages
Reviews.Author: Long Time Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: This is the second Nokia 620 I bought - this one 10 months after I purchased my own - I purchased this for my spouse - she really liked mine.  It is a Windows 8 phone - which is a huge advantage because its interface is SO SUPERIOR to android and apple - which I refer to as icon "throw-up" - many, many unforgotten icons lettered so small as to be unusable - except perhaps by those possessing eagle eyes.  After dumping an android droid for this phone - very, very happy.  If you need all of the exotic apps that apple and android offer - then this phone would not likely please you as Microsoft app selection remains far behind the others - but for most normal users there are plenty of apps and the number increases steadily.  Highly recommend - small and powerful - using both with Straight Talk ---- $49.70 total per month (each) with taxes.

Reviews.Title: A truely amazing phone + OS -- all combined with a great price
Reviews.Author: Malhar Shah
Reviews.Content: WARNING : This phone/Windows OS is so good that it'll make you forget the Apple/Android. I bought this as a gift for a family member and she's hooked to it. Because Facebook/IM/photos are "live", she actually looks forward to clicking and using those apps every time she turns the screen ON. Unlike Android / iPhone where you have to click each app, this phone makes everything come alive -- and not just social-network-stuff, but also simple things as "To Do" list, or Weather-app or News app -- it's all right there on the home page. No need for additional clicking/tapping.As far as the hardware is concerned, this phone is not having a super-large screen -- which in my scenario was a plus. It's an excellent smart-phone for the price. You can't go wrong with less than $150 (including shipping) for a smart-phone with 3.8" display, front-camera, rear camera (5 megapixel), Wi-Fi, 8 GB memory, SD card slot.Originally I thought the white-plastic case would make the phone less durable, but so far it doesn't seem the case. Phone is solid.Nokia has done a great job in build quality as well as keeping the software updated. There are tons of Nokia apps available. I also was able to download the latest WP8 updates.Cons:* It's not a 4G phone (then again the owner doesn't really need/care for 3G/4G). I also didn't expect 4G/LTE etc for the price* Screen is not retina display quality - found in latest Windows/Galaxy/iOS devices

Reviews.Title: Great phone
Reviews.Author: a1cowggirll
Reviews.Content: runs fast, windows 8 platform, works with xbox music and games/apps, requires a micro sim card, and you can use this phone on the BYOP plan through Straight Talk wireless.  So far I am happy with the phone.  The camera takes good pictures, not great pictures.  Daytime pictures are better than low light or night pictures.  It has a lot of features, but does not work with google play or many popular apps, limited on what I am able to do in certain areas, but I am sure that will change as windows expands is apps.

Reviews.Title: Nokia has made another great
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I have used Nokia phones before. Each has been some of the toughest phones I have every handled and this one is no exception. I bought my wife and myself, both one.At first, I was suspicious of the unlocked part. But, once I received it, it was, in fact, UNLOCKED. It wokr fine with Straight Talk's AT&T; micro sim and the data and SMS work fine with the info provided on Straight Talks website.So, don't hesitate if you're using Straight Talk, just buy it!!! And remember, restart your phone after you put in the data and SMS info.
